basics.name: Yang Qian
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate in Computer Science
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate in Computer Science at the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa, focusing on computer vision and foundation models for healthcare applications. Expected graduation: Spring 2026.

education.summary: Doctoral student in Computer Science with a focus on machine learning and vision for healthcare.
Master of Science in Computer Science. Research focus on emotion recognition and foundation models.
Bachelor of Arts with double major coursework in Mathematics (2017–2018) and Computer Science (2018–2021).

work.company: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa - CIRP Lab
work.summary: Research on fine-tuning action recognition models, developing diagnostic tools for ASD, and contributing to CVPR 2025 workshop infrastructure.
highlights: Built and maintained the evaluation pipeline for the CVPR 2025 Bin Picking Challenge
Investigated vision transformer models for ASD behavioral screening

work.company: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa - Digital Health Lab
work.summary: Applied machine learning research to diagnostic models for pediatric developmental delays using real-world video data.

work.company: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa - AMMI Lab
work.summary: Worked on robotics and medical instrumentation with image/data processing tasks.
Supported courses in programming and computational thinking, including grading and instructional duties.

projects.name: CVPR 2025 Bin Picking Challenge
projects.description: Built the baseline and helped organize the CVPR 2025 PIRA workshop challenge with Intrinsic and OpenCV.

projects.name: ASD Diagnosis with VideoMAE
projects.description: Developed a diagnostic pipeline using a ViT-based foundation model to classify ASD using short unstructured videos from the GuessWhat dataset.

projects.name: TikTok Action Recognition Foundation Model
projects.description: Led pretraining and benchmark experiments on a 283k+ clip dataset to train a domain-specific foundation model for action recognition.

awards.title: Hawai‘i Data Science Institute Fellowship
awards.summary: Fellowship awarded for graduate-level research in data science.

awards.title: International Student Excellence Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship recognizing academic excellence for international students.

publications.name: A Linear Programming and Deep Reinforcement Learning Framework to Choose Dwell Positions and Dwell Time in High-Dose-Rate Prostate Brachytherapy Using Curvilinear Catheters
publications.publisher: ASME International Mechanical Engineering Congress and Exposition (IMECE)
publications.authors: Yang Qian, Peter Washington, Tarun K Podder, Bardia Konh
publications.summary: Presented at ASME IMECE 2024. Combines linear programming and deep reinforcement learning to optimize dwell positions and times in HDR prostate brachytherapy.

publications.name: TikTokActions: A TikTok-Derived Video Dataset for Human Action Recognition
publications.authors: Yang Qian, Yinan Sun, Ali Kargarandehkordi, Onur Cezmi Mutlu, Saimourya Surabhi, Pingyi Chen, Zain Jabbar, Dennis Paul Wall, Peter Washington
publications.summary: Introduces TikTokActions, a large-scale dataset for action recognition and foundation model pretraining. arXiv:2402.08875

publications.name: Computer Vision Estimation of Emotion Reaction Intensity in the Wild
publications.authors: Yang Qian, Ali Kargarandehkordi, Onur Cezmi Mutlu, Saimourya Surabhi, Mohammadmahdi Honarmand, Dennis Paul Wall, Peter Washington
publications.summary: Presents models for estimating emotional reaction intensity. Developed for the ABAW ERI challenge. arXiv:2303.10741

publications.name: Enhancing Automatic Emotion Recognition for Clinical Applications
publications.summary: Master’s thesis on multimodal personalized facial expression recognition and emotion intensity estimation.
